item.title: Report E-2023090714
item.description:
Report E-2023090714

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: POPLARVILLE
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AmeriGas Propane, L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 8/14/2023 no defects were noted during pre-trip. Jerry left the Centreville yard for St. Rose, LA at approx. 8:15am CST. Stopped for diesel fuel in MS and no defects were noted prior to leaving the gas station. Jerry noted that traffic was moderate with some construction zones that caused him to use his brakes more often. At approx. 1:00pm CST Jerry was passing a car in the left lane at 70 mph. and noticed smoke coming from under the rear portion of the trailer. Heard a loud bang and pulled to the right side of the road as soon as he was able. Jerry grabbed the fire extinguisher and noticed flames coming from the passenger side of the tractor below the 5th wheel - he emptied the extinguisher out and ran when unable to control. He called 911 at this time. The flames from the tractor engulfed the trailer and caused pressure relief valves to discharge propane and the propane ignited spreading to all 1344 cylinders being affected. Traffic was stopped in the Northbound lanes and first responders arrived within 10 min. and immediately secured the scene. The fire and release lasted about 30 min. to an hour while local first responders ensured the flames didn't spread. The interstate was shutdown for close to three hours and the scene was cleaned up.

item.title: Report X-2023090294
item.description:
Report X-2023090294

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS FOUND DAMAGED ON QAT LINE. LEAKING AND WAS NOT IN A TOTE. DescribePack: LEAKING ON ALL FOUR SIDES, THE TOPS WERE NOT ON TIGHT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS HANDLED PROPERLY USING THE CORRECT HAZARDOUS MATERIALS.

item.title: Report X-2023090280
item.description:
Report X-2023090280

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The plastic containers should be sealed with the caps tightened. Also, our package handlers not minding the directional arrows contributed to the leakage. DescribePack: Package was seemingly dropped during the transport process and dented from the bottom and leaked from the bottom and the top side from the caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Improper handling of the package.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Plastic container lids of gallon jugs had loose caps and did not seem to be sealed properly. DescribePack: Loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was contained in a plastic tote to prevent further spillage.
